column4: and yes, i already tried those websites... with no success...
there is not a way to "repair" an ubuntu instalation?
lots of ways. check for loaded modules first:   lsmod | grep snd , you should see a handful of modules regarding sound
i don't have any module loaded regarding sound
hm, compiling kernel modules can be problematic, and hard to troubleshoot. Did the install complete successfully?
i only tried to install the realktec drivers, and yes, it seemed to complete successfully, but without finding any appropiate driver for my computer
I have no experience with that sound chip, so I'd be stabbing in the dark trying to troubleshoot remotely. I'd suggest posting to that thread for help.
oh, you had working sound at one time, with the default install? Prior to running that script?
yes, exactly
sudo apt-get install --reinstall  linux-image-$(uname -r) should get you back your sound then
you'll need to reboot after running that
i already rebooted
did you run the reinstall command above?
run the reinstall command I gave you above, then reboot
and you'll probably need to remove any changes to alsa-base you made
i'm running the command right now, sorry, i missed that line
get a better irc client, it'll highlight lines written to you ;)
i use pidgin, it highlight the lines.. it's just me, that I never pay enough attention
heh. That's why I also have a chime set for lines with my nick, I'm inattentive a lot also
it worked, i can listen to music right now
yw
